update.description:
This PR adds support for frame semantics as implemented in [SDFormat PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1). It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.


## Requirements:
* ~~libsdformat7 [PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1)~~
* libsdformat9 PRs [PR 640](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/640) and [PR 647](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/647)

## TODO:
* ~~Add support for joint axis `expressed_in` attribute.~~
* ~~Add frame semantics for model editor ~~
* ~~Check if saved sdf files preserve frame semantics. This could be by simply storing the transformed poses as opposed to keeping `frames` and `relative_to`s intact. ~~

cc: @{557057:f3a199b9-5784-4964-9644-6ef224bc7dc1}
update.title: Support SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics

content.raw: Yeah, not the best name. We want something that says "convert poses by resolving them to their default parent (relative_to) frames", but I can't think of something short. I'm okay with `convertPosesToSdf16`.
content.html: Yeah, not the best name. We want something that says "convert poses by resolving them to their default parent (relative_to) frames", but I can't think of something short. I'm okay with convertPosesToSdf16.

the prerelease has been made (thanks @{557058:155a32e2-420c-4d50-98e0-0e722f63f906}!), and I've started new jenkins jobs using the release-tools PR:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/939/gazebo11-use-sdf9/diff

I also queued a homebrew build using the related homebrew PR:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64&build=1865)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1865/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1865/
* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/945

content.raw: I'm trying to decide what this function should be called; maybe `convertPosesToSdf16`? It is resolving poses under the hood, but really modifying the poses in the sdf Element
content.html: I'm trying to decide what this function should be called; maybe convertPosesToSdf16? It is resolving poses under the hood, but really modifying the poses in the sdf Element

content.raw: are these API's (CreateAxis and UpdateAxis) used outside of osrf/gazebo? if so we should consider deprecating and adding an overload
content.html: are these API's (CreateAxis and UpdateAxis) used outside of osrf/gazebo? if so we should consider deprecating and adding an overload

update.description:
This PR adds support for frame semantics as implemented in [SDFormat PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1). It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.

This PR also migrates Gazebo to ign-math5. I can split this out into its own PR once the TODOs are finished.

## Requirements:
* ign-math5
* ~~libsdformat7 [PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1)~~
* libsdformat9 PRs [PR 640](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/640) and [PR 647](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/647)

## TODO:
* Add support for joint axis `expressed_in` attribute.
* Add frame semantics for model editor 
* Check if saved sdf files preserve frame semantics. This could be by simply storing the transformed poses as opposed to keeping `frames` and `relative_to`s intact. 

cc: @{557057:f3a199b9-5784-4964-9644-6ef224bc7dc1}
update.title: [WIP] Support SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics

update.description:
This PR adds support for frame semantics as implemented in [SDFormat PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1). It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.

This PR also migrates Gazebo to ign-math5. I can split this out into its own PR once the TODOs are finished.

## Requirements:
* ign-math5
* libsdformat7 [PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1)

## TODO:
* Add support for joint axis `expressed_in` attribute.
* Add frame semantics for model editor 
* Check if saved sdf files preserve frame semantics. This could be by simply storing the transformed poses as opposed to keeping `frames` and `relative_to`s intact. 

cc: @{557057:f3a199b9-5784-4964-9644-6ef224bc7dc1}
update.title: [WIP] Support SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics

content.raw: Thanks for the PR. Works great!
content.html: Thanks for the PR. Works great!

this seems to fix inserting a PR2 from the gui (requires that sdf PR):

diff -r a72fc496e195 gazebo/gui/ModelMaker.cc
--- a/gazebo/gui/ModelMaker.cc  Tue Jan 14 14:10:54 2020 -0600
+++ b/gazebo/gui/ModelMaker.cc  Wed Jan 15 10:56:18 2020 -0800
@@ -111,7 +111,8 @@
   this->dataPtr->modelSDF.reset(new sdf::SDF);
   sdf::initFile("root.sdf", this->dataPtr->modelSDF);

-  if (!sdf::readFile(_filename, this->dataPtr->modelSDF))
+  sdf::Errors errors;
+  if (!sdf::readFile(_filename, this->dataPtr->modelSDF, false, errors))
   {
     gzerr << "Unable to load file[" << _filename << "]\n";
     return false;

content.raw:
I've added an overload of `sdf::readFile` with a boolean parameter to disable conversion to the latest sdf version, which should help with this:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/647/parser-add-boolean-parameter-to-readfile/diff
content.html:
I've added an overload of sdf::readFile with a boolean parameter to disable conversion to the latest sdf version, which should help with this:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/647/parser-add-boolean-parameter-to-readfile/diff

content.raw: with the latest changes that check the original sdf version, I can load `worlds/pr2.world`, but if I click to insert a PR2 into a simulation using gzclient, it doesn't work, because [gazebo::gui::ModelMaker calls sdf::readFile](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a72fc496e1952f11dca3c69edfc5b221b7c8544e/gazebo/gui/ModelMaker.cc#lines-114), which up-converts to 1.7, then sends that sdf string to `~/factory`. Perhaps we could use `sdf::convertFile` instead of `sdf::readFile` to try to keep it at its original version?
content.html: with the latest changes that check the original sdf version, I can load worlds/pr2.world, but if I click to insert a PR2 into a simulation using gzclient, it doesn't work, because gazebo::gui::ModelMaker calls sdf::readFile, which up-converts to 1.7, then sends that sdf string to ~/factory. Perhaps we could use sdf::convertFile instead of sdf::readFile to try to keep it at its original version?

content.raw:
perhaps we could use the `*` operator instead of `+` in any code we end up changing (not trying to change it all, but if we're changing it anyway)

I think we have to reverse the order: `this->parentEntity->worldPose * this->SDFPoseRelativeToParent()`?
content.html:
perhaps we could use the * operator instead of + in any code we end up changing (not trying to change it all, but if we're changing it anyway)

I think we have to reverse the order: this->parentEntity->worldPose * this->SDFPoseRelativeToParent()?

It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.

This PR also migrates Gazebo to ign-math5. I can split this out into its own PR once the TODOs are finished.

## TODO:

update.title: [WIP] Support SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics

content.html:
there is an sdformat pull request that exposes the original version from which an sdf document was parsed:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/640

that API could be used with a patch like the following to relax the strictness of the error checking for sdf < 1.7

diff -r eac446d21115 gazebo/physics/Model.cc
--- a/gazebo/physics/Model.cc   Thu Jan 09 08:59:01 2020 -0800
+++ b/gazebo/physics/Model.cc   Thu Jan 09 09:35:52 2020 -0800
@@ -29,6 +29,7 @@
 #include <boost/function.hpp>
 #include <boost/thread/recursive_mutex.hpp>
 #include <ignition/math/Pose3.hh>
+#include <ignition/math/SemanticVersion.hh>
 #include <ignition/msgs/plugin_v.pb.h>
 #include <sstream>

@@ -76,10 +77,13 @@
 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
 void Model::Load(sdf::ElementPtr _sdf)
 {
+  ignition::math::SemanticVersion sdfOriginalVersion(_sdf->OriginalVersion());
+
   // Create a DOM object to compute the resolved initial pose (with frame
   // semantics)
   sdf::Errors errors = this->modelSDFDom.Load(_sdf);
-  if (!errors.empty())
+  if (sdfOriginalVersion >= ignition::math::SemanticVersion(1, 7)
+      && !errors.empty())
   {
     for (const auto &error : errors)
     {

patch edited with ParsedVersion -> OriginalVersion
